Name: Renaming City-owned property after living persons.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to renaming City-owned property after living persons.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1. Section 25-102.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 28 for the year 1992, is amended by adding a new subdivision d to read as follows:
d: No local law shall name any street, park, playground or portion thereof, or any facility or structure located and laid out on the city map after a living person.
Â§2. This law shall become effective immediately after it is submitted for the approval of the qualified electors of the city at the next general election held after its enactment and approved by a majority of such electors voting thereon.


KS
LS # 3818
8/27/2012
